description: The four large canvases by Hubert Robert in the Art Institute's collection were commissioned by wealthy ﬁnancier Jean-Joseph, Marquis de Laborde, to decorate a salon in his château at Méréville, France. Robert was much sought after as a painter of architectural ruins, a genre that appealed to the late 18th-century taste for the antique. He cultivated his knowledge of antiquity over more than a decade of travel and study in Italy.
title: The Old Temple
